mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, Martha Washington to Mrs. Elizabeth Powel, 1788 January 18
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Washington, Martha, 1731-1802
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Martha writes of the Powel's trip from Mount Vernon to Philadelphia -- they must come more often -- thanks for collars for the girls [these were to correct posture; see Mrs. Powel's letter of Nov. 30, 1787 for description] -- also, ribbons and sashes -- "My pretty Boy"[George Washington Parke Custis] pleased with book, will write her himself -- Fanny's health improved -- goes to her father's to have baby in March -- Fanny's brother to marry Miss McCarty -- "She is as a child to me, and I am very lone some when she is absent. Her ill luck with her first child is the only reason of her wishing to change the place of her laying inn this time." -- moroco [morocco] thread case came safely -- sorry the Powel's couldn't stay longer at Mount Vernon -- "... tho we are not as gay as you are at Philadelphia yet in this peace full retreat you will find friendship and cordiallity [cordiality] ..." -- sympathy with [Mrs. P.'s] sister [Mrs. Byrd's] troubles -- Mrs. [Eleanor Calvert Custis] Stuart has lost her father--Custis girls send thanks for collars. Autograph letter signed, 5 pages.
